headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Board of Education. MECHANICS' INSTITUTE SCHOOL-FIFTEENTH ANNUAL EXHIBITION. DISCHARGED.--Some months since, BENJAMIN W. KINDALL THE VETERANE OF 1812. PAINFUL DEATH. FATAL ACCIDENTS SALES OF REAL ESTATE BY ALBERT H. NICOLAY, APRIL 26, AT STAPLETON, STATEN ISLAND: Important Decision in Admiralty. U. S. DISTRICT COURT.--Wednesday. Before' Judge Ingersoll. CARRIER--DELIVERY OF CARGO--CUSTOM OF THE PORT--NAVAL STORES. MARINE COURT. UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT--Wednesday. Before His Honor Judge Betts. DISTRICT COURT--FIRST JUDICIAL DISTRICT. U. S. MARSHAL'S OFFICE--Thursday. COURT CALENDAR--FRIDAY.

docs.lead_paragraph: A special meeting of the Board of Education was held on Wednesday evening--E. C. BENEDICT, Esq., President, in the Chair. A communication was received from the School officers of the Nineteenth Ward, nominating James Gallagher, Denis Tubridy, and Harmon Eldridge, for Trustees of Public Schools for that Ward, in accordance with the amended School law. The nominations were confirmed.

docs.lead_paragraph: MEETING OF THE COMMITTEE ON RAILROADS.--The Committee on Railroads of the Board of Councilmen consisting of Messrs. KIMBARK, WILD, BEAKLEY, YOUNG and NORTH, was held in the Chamber of the Board of Councilmen, yesterday, to take into consideration the propriety of prohibiting the use of steam on the Harlem Railroad below Forty-second-street.

headline.main: LATER FROM HAVANA.; Arrival and Departure of the Black Warrior. OUTRAGE ON THE U. S. CONSUL.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamer Black Warrior arrived at her anchorage this evening at 4 3/4 o'clock, and the only annoyance she found from our authorities was an earnestness to get her out of port with the least possible delay practicable, and she will be under steam for Mobile at 6 o'clock to-morrow morning.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times:

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editors of the Louisville Journal: GENTLEMEN: The WARD case increases in interest as the trial progresses. From day to day, an immense crowd gathers in the Court-house, and all listen with eager attention to the protracted details of the evidence. Quite a large number of witnesses were examined to-day, and among them, the father and mother of the accused.

headline.main: IMPORTANT TRIAL.; The Kentucky Murder Case. Trial of Matt. F. Ward for the Murder of Professor Butler. Full Report of the Testimony.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Louisville Courier. HARDIN COUNTY CIRCUIT COURT. Before Judge Kinchelue. The Commonwealth vs. Matt. F. Ward and R. J. Ward, Jr. The indictment in the first count charges M. F. WARD and R. J. WARD, Jr., with shooting, with malice aforethought, W. H. G. BUTLER, in the city of Louisville, on the 2d of November last, causing his death on the 3d of said month.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Authority and the Revolution. United Order of Americans. Anniversary of the Orphan Asylam. UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT--Monday. TUESDAY. FIRST DISTRICT COURT--Monday. SUPREME COURT--SPECIAL TERM. SUPERIOR COURT.--TRIAL TERM--Tuesday. MARINE COURT. COURT CALENDAR

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. J. V. HUNTINGTON, Editor of the Catholic Metropolitan Magazine, of Baltimore, lectured on Monday evening at the Broadway Tabernacle, on "Authority and the Revolution," to an audience which was not very numerous, but seemed fully to agree with the speaker.

headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; The James-street Albray--Dying Testimony of William Hughes.

docs.lead_paragraph: This affray, an account of which appeared in the TIMES of yesterday morning, it now appears occurred in a barroom on James-street, kept by ANTON SMITH. WILLIAM HUGHES, the party stabbed, is not expected to recover, and accordingly Judges MOORE and SMITH yesterday proceeded to his residence, No. 51 Adams-street, and took his dying declaration, which is as follows:
